main event: Several unidentified lights were observed over San Antonio, Texas, on 25 March 1953, moving from north to south for about 1 hour and 30 minutes.
interesting points: The lights traveled in a circular course with at least two more lights appearing after the initial ones disappeared,The observer reported seeing a trail similar to a comet but with no lasting visibility,The speed of the lights was described as faster than any known aircraft,Despite attempts to detect the objects on radar, there were no confirmed radar readings,An additional witness reported the lights to the Kelly AFB control tower, who had observed similar phenomena.
witness description: An Air Force officer and his wife observed the lights.
